Title: Software Engineer II
Job_Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
Honeywell changes the way the world works.

For more than 130 years, we’ve solved the toughest customer challenges through a rare combination of our industrial expertise and our innovations in ground breaking software and technology, and industry-leading automation.
This perfection is built on a foundation of inclusion, diversity and driving a performance culture that values integrity and ethics.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

We lead with software and innovation.
Whether we’re turning mustard seeds into fuel, creating quantum algorithms or making taxis fly, our software engineering team is home to the world’s leading technological talent.

We want software engineers who not only have a solid foundation in coding, development, designing, testing and even hacking, but who also have a passion for empowering the world and making it a better place for everyone – today and tomorrow.

The candidate’s initial assignment will be supporting and maintaining solutions for Engineering Business Management (EBM) tools such as Aerospace Estimation Tool (AET). The AET development is part of a group of productivity projects to aid in the improvement of the quoting efforts within Honeywell Aerospace. AET serves as a single Aero-wide solution for estimation. This tool promotes a consistent quoting and reporting process, reduces the time it takes to generate an estimate by facilitating ease of access, communication, versioning, archival and electronic approval of estimates.

Candidate will perform day-to-day application support including user account management, guide, and train application users globally, master data management. Monitor and perform maintenance of the systems to ensure reliable performance. This role also includes systems requirements elicitation, process validation, testing support and training material preparation. Candidate will meet with users to understand their issues or requirements and then determine and test an appropriate solution. The person must be able to make recommendations as to any work around that may be appropriate. They will also be responsible for additional tasks as assigned.

Title: SCRTY MGR 1 (Security Services Manager)
Job_Description:
The Security Services Division provides protection and safety to the University of California, Davis community (faculty, staff, students, and visitors) and property located at the Davis Campus and within the UCD sphere of influence. The Security Manager leads the UC Davis Police Department Security Services Division, which provides security services 24 hours per day, 7 days per week, at various locations via roving patrol and fixed post assignments.
Job Summary
Under the direct supervision of the Police Captain, the Security Services Manager will manage the Physical System Security Division (PSSD), Community Service Specialists (CSS), Protective Service Supervisors, Protective Services Specialists (PSS), and Project Policy Analyst within the Security Services Division (SSD). The CSS and PSS are new programs and a key component of the holistic approach to tiered policing. The CSS’ and PSS’ must integrate closely with police patrol operations. The PSSD is an existing unit which is responsible for a myriad of physical and technical security components including: security assessments, security cameras, access control, and alarms systems. Collaboration between the various UCDPD units and the UCD community will be essential to reimagine the delivery of safety services to the community. The Security Services Manager shall maintain a working knowledge of security industry best practices and ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.

Title: SCRTY MGR 1 (Security Services Manager)
Job_Description:
The Security Services Division provides protection and safety to the University of California, Davis community (faculty, staff, students, and visitors) and property located at the Davis Campus and within the UCD sphere of influence. The Security Manager leads the UC Davis Police Department Security Services Division, which provides security services 24 hours per day, 7 days per week, at various locations via roving patrol and fixed post assignments.
Job Summary
Under the direct supervision of the Police Captain, the Security Services Manager will manage the Physical System Security Division (PSSD), Community Service Specialists (CSS), Protective Service Supervisors, Protective Services Specialists (PSS), and Project Policy Analyst within the Security Services Division (SSD). This includes serving the UC Davis campus and its affiliate properties. The Security Services Manager’s responsibilities include: providing leadership and managerial oversight for the Division, aligning Division responsibilities with the mission, vision, and goals of UCDPD, developing and maintaining policy and procedures, researching, implementing and supporting new and ongoing security-related technology, and ensuring effective training for staff to meet industry and University standards. In collaboration with the Police Captain and UCD Police Department (UCDPD) leadership team, the Security Services Manager will assist with establishing and maintaining program goals, identifying benchmarks through strategic planning, and analyzing crime trends to introduce early mitigation strategies to enhance campus safety. The CSS and PSS are new programs and a key component of the holistic approach to tiered policing. The CSS’ and PSS’ must integrate closely with police patrol operations. The PSSD is an existing unit which is responsible for a myriad of physical and technical security components including: security assessments, security cameras, access control, and alarms systems. Collaboration between the various UCDPD units and the UCD community will be essential to reimagine the delivery of safety services to the community. The Security Services Manager shall maintain a working knowledge of security industry best practices and ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.
